title: SLICK JOINT
text: INTRODUCTION Murphy Eze (Chef)I am Murphy Eze, with over seven years of extensive experience in cooking French cuisine. Experience with operating adining service of up to 200 tables while supervising staff to ensure they perform to the best oftheir ability during service. I was passionate about cooking and enjoy seeing clients satisfiedeating the exquisite food that I make.I graduated top in my class in 2013 from Liaison College in Culinary Arts. Elsie Eze (Self Employed)I'm Elsie Eze, with over 15 years of experience running a professional commercial cleaning company. The company services commercial and medical buildings, homes, and condos. I manage to be a staff of 8 and enjoys being an entrepreneur. With many years of business, and industry-compatible experience, the principals (Murphy andElsie Eze) we have developed sound skill sets that properly suit operating a business such as Slick Joint. We thoroughly understood the subject market, the fundamentals of the industry segment, the business model, its best practices, and what is required to succeed. The purpose of this campaign Is to illustrate the feasibility of establishing a casual fare / quick-service and take-out café / shop in Toronto, Ontario to move our business from home to the street of Toronto, Ontario. The menu cuisine will be primarily based on fresh convenience and finger foods. The company will trade as Slick Joint. It is a registered proprietorship owned and operated by Murphy and Elsie Eze (“the principals”) who are experienced professionals and chef Murray Eze will run the kitchen. The reason why we need your help to raise the funds Why did we need your help? To open a slick Joint shop in Toronto street and brings customers from the opening day as a new shop. We are going to provide food for any customers who can not afford to buy it. Welcome to Family of Slick Joint Chef Murphy and Elsie Eze We need your help to raise the funds. We are home base gourmet pastries and street finger foods. Through the pandemic coronavirus, we persevere and believe the future is bright. we need all your help from the Slick Joint opening, Sept 30th,2021. We need funds for the shop and renovations. We need your generosity, kindness, and support to bring our shop to life on Toronto street. All our cuisines are fresh food prepared and cooked on the spot. Our menu is from all over the world with finger gourmet cuisine. We are one shop Gourmet Street Cuisine and Pastries needs. We pledge to raise $50,000 to accomplish the goal and also, the donations are not free slick Joint will send out vouchers a week before the Grand opening to all our kind-hearted customers to redeem the donations for any products in our shop, we need your support, in any contributions you make will have an impact in reaching out to our goal and come and join the Slick Joint family for the celebration., God bless us all thanks. Your help and support to raise this fund with any amount of your contributions will help us in achieving our goal. SHORT TERM (36 MONTHS) GOALS To execute a detailed and efficient marketing campaign (see marketing section) as expeditiously as possible To accomplish minimum revenues of $440,000 for Fiscal Year End 1 (“FYE 1”), $ 610,000 for FYE 2, and $700,000 for FYE 3 To maintain strong net profit margins and profitability by the end of FYE 1 To continuously increase the shop’s goodwill and client base To continuously promote the Slick Joint brand To cultivate iconic company culture. LONG TERM GOALS To become renowned as a superb quick stop shop To achieve excellent operating best practices To examine scalability in contemplation of building a multi-unit or franchise-based network. USE OF START-UP FUNDS The Company requires $190,000 to complement the principal’s significant investment to execute start-up equipment, marketing, and working capital strategies. Per the following summary, a $105,000 investment has been provided by the principal and a $120,000 loan will be negotiated. * Equipment includes coffee machine, food service equipment (toasters, microwave, fridges, coolers, dishwasher, etc.), counters, racks, prep tables, storage, etc., small wares, utensils, store fixtures/furniture, office/security, and miscellaneous store, including signs and/or banners/posters. ** Deposits are first and last on utilities and insurance *** LOAN - $120,000 amortized over 84 months at a rate of 6% (simple interest) yields a monthly payment of $1,753 – monthly interest and principal pay-down per the amortization schedule SLICK JOINT EQUIPMENT WAREHOUSE LOCATION AND FACILITIES OF THE BUSINESS The Greater Toronto Municipal Area (“GTMA”) features a population of almost 6 million people, with a 2011to 2016 annualized population growth rate of a robust 6.2%. Toronto is Canada’s largest city with a population above 2.8 million people. It is an economic powerhouse, with a business population of over 100,000 businesses. It was just reported that Toronto / the GTA has now surpassed 6 million residents. The GTA is renowned for its huge diversity in the economy, culture and vocations, and huge commercial presence. Toronto features excellent accessibility, to and from, and in and around the region, with several major highways and streets complemented by premiere air and rail facilities. All of the foregoing traits make Toronto and the GTA a “marketer’s dream, " a superb opportunity for obtaining prospects. Over the period of 2011 to 2017, the population growth rate in the GTA was a distinctive 6%. 43 Goldwin Ave, is in the high-density residential neighborhood of Weston – York, which is west-central Toronto. Other nearby neighborhoods include Weston, Rockcliffe-Smythe, Humber Heights, and Keelesdale, and the city of Etobicoke is also close by. The address is adjacent to the Chord Housing Co-op. Company Operating Systems The company’s systems needs are threefold: (1) a sales / POS / CSR management system (“SMS”), (2) business administration system (“BAS”) and online / “e-commerce capabilities for social media, marketing, e-mail, etc. (“E-System”). The SMS handles sales, POS, cash entries, and data. The BAS system handles client records and all business requisites, such as financial / bookkeeping, payroll, management reports, etc., and E-System handles marketing and communications, mobile management, etc. Numerous valid and market-proven systems are available, including, but definitely not limited to, Revel and Touch Bistro. The optimum operating capabilities provided will include: CRM and ongoing goodwill programs Client data records and client service records Leads obtained from various marketing sources Sales, costing, pricing, profitability Purchasing, inventory, and waste Internet, online functions, and “e-commerce” Production of regular reports, including financial and online banking Record keeping Trending SLICK JOINT PRODUCTS The menu will be casual flare and will feature key items such as: Imagawayaki waffles Empanadas Mayo's mash potatoes Japanese cheesecake Chicken meat pie Turkey meat pie Parisian crustless french pie Artisan Crustless Cheesecake Banana Tart Scotch Eggs Beef meat pie and more. The shop motto: “committed to the best food that fits well with a customer’s diet – fresh, natural and organic foods from a creative menu and foods that exceeds our customers’ expectations”. Also excelling at special events and occasions – weddings, custom cakes, anniversaries cakes, gift baskets, bread, pastries, and cupcakes - and accommodating deliveries, Slick Joint has built up a strong reputation and client goodwill. COVID 19 – BUSINESS IMPACT The Covid 19 disruption is obviously causing negative economic impacts and some analysts are mentioning the possibility of a recession. Various experts are forecasting the demise of the virus to begin by late spring but others are anticipating by the end of summer, while others are even less optimistic. The current reality of the virus is that 81% of those who get it are mild cases, 13.8% need more intense treatment, and around 2% are likely to die. It is fact that the measures of governmental precautions and social distancing are now flattening the growth curve significantly. The ongoing warm weather may also act to discourage the virus. The impact on the company is difficult to absolutely determine, but it is logical to anticipate consumer confidence and the desire to make large financial commitments will be diminished, and many consumers may opt to defer larger projects. It is reasonable to assume these will fuel pent-up demand later in the year (a period of recovery). It is just reported that what appear to be viable vaccines are now in the test stage and could be implemented in reasonably short order. Some of the risks that the Covid 19 situation presents to the business are: (1) diminished sales (2) irregularities in staffing (3) disruption of some supply channels (4) skewing of the operating budget and cash flows and, (5) a safe working environment. The formulation of these projections is an opportunity for the company to do a strategies reality check and double-check its state of preparedness. The company's "Covid 19 Action Plan" 1) The projection calls for reduced sales levels from Oct 2021 to Jan. 2022 - the company must work extra- hard at attracting sales via such things as networking, local flyers, "specials", intense social media use, and word-of-mouth. 2) The company will be proactive in promoting customer benefits and "do it now!" special offers. 3) The company will continue to establish goodwill and manage long-term and loyal client relationships and this asset will be conscientiously "mined" and word-of-mouth encouraged at every opportunity. 4) The company can consider such diversifications as on-demand, “e-services”, delivery/curbside, and special-ordered services 5) The company must have a "tightened belt" approach to variable costs. 6) The company will be vigilant in 'staying on top of “governmental” and community support (business and employee) assistance 7) Ownership needs to constantly and diligently watch sales trends, expenses, costs of materials and supplies, hours, and staff productivity at an unprecedented level - daily audits The nature of the company’s services challenges it to operate in a totally “arms-length” / socially distanced manner, strategically avoiding close interaction with clients wherever possible, and the company will be diligent in applying the protocols and procedures required to optimize execution of a safety-first agenda. ANOTHER WAY YOU CAN SUPPORT OUR CAMPAIGN You can also help by helping us promote the campaign and drop your enthusiasm comment on our campaign page.

title: Keeping Honey Real
text: Honey is the one sweetener that doesn't need processing. Honey is ready to eat right out of the hive But that purity is being challenged Syrups from starch are being added to honey. These syrups have none of the richness of natural honey. None of the flavour and character – none of why people call honey “the nectar of the gods” It's time to stop this. People deserve to know what they are eating We are Jerry and Peter Awram, long-time beekeepers. Jerry starting in 1956 and his son, Peter, grew up in the business. We’ve spent countless days searching for queens, splitting hives and pulling honey. We know bees and we know honey. Real honey is like wine. It differs depending on the flowers the bees visit, the time of year and the weather. All these combine to give a delectable flavour that can't be matched. People should be able to taste the sharp flavour of honey from Maple trees, the light taste of Fireweed and the pungency of Buckwheat. Starch Syrups have none of the richness of honey For well over a decade now, honey adulteration has been increasing at an alarming rate. The biggest food fraud case in history involved fraud in honey of over $80 million in 2010, but it didn't stop anything. Honey fraud has been getting worse since then. Some countries have more than doubled the amount of honey they export with no increase in hive numbers. This is while hive yields in North and South America and Europe have declined. The numbers don't add up. The data show that up to 40% more honey is being sold than is being made by bees. There is a new technology that allows detection of these Starch Syrups Magnetic Resonance is one of the most powerful analytical methods available today. MRI machines in hospitals use the same technology to image people's bodies. With magnetic resonance you can make an "image" of honey. You can see everything making up that richness. The images from starch syrups are flat and lifeless. True Honey Buzz has one of only a handful of Magnetic Resonance Machines in the world for testing honey. We can now image honey and challenge the scammers head on. Our Honey Screener is a research quality Magnetic Resonance capable of examining a wide range of materials. It is currently set up to look at honey, wine and juice, but would not be out of place in top university labs. We are collaborating with several researchers at the University of British Columbia to compare the data generated with our machine to with that of Raman Spectrophotometry and Mass Spectrometry. Magnetic Resonance uses a super-conducting magnet to "ring" the honey sample like a bell - or a whole orchestra. Then you listen to the "sound" or resonance that comes back. Honey sounds like a rich symphony, while starch syrup is like the annoying buzz of the alarm clock in the morning. The image that is generated by Magnetic Resonance is like a fingerprint. Unique to the flower and where the honey came from. But like a fingerprint, you need a database to compare it against and the larger the database the better. And our test is more like a DNA fingerprint. We can see the related samples as well as the identical matches. We need good honey samples to generate the database. That's where we need your help. Beekeepers and Honey Lovers around the world need to send us samples. This will help us expand the honey database and we will give you an analysis report of the sample you sent in. We are able to identify sugars, amino acids and other organic compounds allowing us to give you a good idea of the content of your honey. As the database grows it is possible to re-examine the data and find out more about the sample. More samples means more data. We need samples from around the world. Everywhere that bees make honey and from every flower that they gather nectar. All beekeepers need to worry about adulterated honey Starch syrups are too easy to get. A quick internet search will yield a dozen in a few seconds, All Beekeepers need to fight this - the purity of honey is being destroyed by these scammers. You can help! The evidence is clear. We live in a world of fake honey. It needs to be stopped at all levels. You can support us by buying a test and sending us a sample of honey. Don't have your own honey? Find honey from someone else - your local beekeeper or off the store shelf and get the data we need to convince the government that we need to crack down on this phoney honey. Can't afford a full test - then hit the donate button - we will put your donation to good work and let you access the map showing our results. Once samples start coming in we will show you what we are finding and keep you up to date on our successes in fighting honey fraud. Other Ways You Can Help Let others know about this problem Send a letter to your government official telling them that you don't like what is happening Share our campaign on Facebook and other places This is a problem for everyone. Whether you eat honey or not. Bees are so much more than honey.

title: Spirit Bar Launch
text: Who We Are Hello. We are Laurel Cook and Antonio Bonilla, owners of Spirit Bar. We are a liquor infusion and bitters company in Portland, Oregon and we need your help to launch our business! Spirit Bar is a return to the original use of alcohol and spirits as medicine and connection to the land. Spirit Bar infusions and bitters can be used as herbal remedies and as a simple way to make a complex cocktail with less ingredients. Through sourcing local spirits and herbs we strive to support local farmers and distillers. Our infusions educate our customers on the history of alcohol as a vehicle for plant medicine. Our goal is to bring intention back to imbibement. We are minority business owners raising money to get our company off the ground. Portland is a town where small businesses thrive, but only a small percentage are minority owned. After working in the service industry for at least a decade each, we are prepared to make our own way with an idea we care about deeply. For over two years we have been developing recipes, educating ourselves in herbal medicine, and creating a buzz though tasting parties. Our local market is eagerly awaiting our products. Your contribution will help us turn this dream into a reality. What We Need We need your help to assist with basic start up costs including: -Licensing -Work Space rental -Bulk herbs and liquor -Production supplies -Branding and Marketing Perks! As well as the opportunity to support two minority business owners and help two passionate people achieve their dreams of creating delicious infused liquor, we are also offering you: A hand crafted charm featuring a medicinal herb A hand screen printed tote bag featuring an original illustration by Laurel A ticket to our amazing launch party that includes delicious food, cocktails, and a special gift bag with samples of our products. This party will you give you an opportunity to meet us and taste our products in person! A private tasting of our infusions and bitters in your home. A custom infusion made to your taste and wellness needs A private dinner party with paired cocktails Please see our perks section for details and combinations. In the unlikely event that we do not reach our funding goal, every penny donated will still go straight to our business. Meeting our funding goal would ensure that we do not have to take out a loan. Why We're Different We realize as cocktail enthusiasts that your local liquor store already has a whole shelf of flavored vodkas and traditional bitters. We feel that our products are unique enough to stand out. Spirit Bar infusions aren't created from artificial flavorings and don't contain added sugar. They are an exciting option for those with mature palates who are ready for something new and exciting. Take our Wild Weed Blend, for example. Starting with a gluten free neutral spirit, we infuse chamomile, lemon balm, and dandelion root to create an herbaceous, easy to drink liquor that soothes your stomach and nerves. Other Ways You Can Help If you are not able to contribute to our campaign financially, please consider: Sharing our campaign with 2 or 3 of your friends and asking them to do the same. Following our Social Media pages and leaving encouraging comments. @spiritbarpdx Joining our email list to receive future updates and track our success. https://mailchi.mp/4ca42c222b86/spiritbar Thinking good thoughts and sending good vibes our way as we strive to achieve our dreams.

title: When Pigs Fly: A Pigasus Story
text: Pigasus & Co was first dreamed up by husband and wife team, Joshua Boyd & Jayna Romine. We are finally ready to make the jump and make this dream a reality. We have multiple options for presale including merchandise, hot sauces, bbq parties, and more! We are totally open to partying it up Illinois if we can coincide it with our bbq tour we will be doing to Illinois in the Spring! We are so freakin excited to get started on this endeavor and are looking forward to all of you being a part of our story. Funds raised will first go to the smoker, and anything left over will go straight to the concession trailer fund! Merchandise and sauces will be sent out before the end of the year, all food stuffs and parties will be ready to rock in the spring.Cheers, friends!Josh, Jayna, Harrison, Garner, Warren

title: Seltz Energy: Focus-Enhancing Energy Seltzer
text: Focus-Enhancing Energy that's backed by Science! A Message From Our Founders We are EXTREMELY excited to launch our campaign for Seltz! We truly believe that this drink is far better than anything else out there, and that it can make a difference in your day. Thank you for your support - we can't wait to share some Seltz with you!-Brandon, Gannon, and MaxTestimonials Our Story For us, it all started with a shared desire to be our best, day in and day out. The Seltz team met in college, that time where there are so many opportunities and things to do that it feels that there's just not enough time... and energy... to do it. That didn't stop us from trying though, and we fell into the all-so-common pattern of alternating between pots of coffee and the newest energy drink (..or both). We were mindlessly "running on caffeine" - that frustrating feeling like you're pushing your body so hard that your mental self just can't keep up.We knew there was a more effective way to use caffeine. It became clear to us that a careful balance of both physical and mental elevation is vital for feeling genuinely energized, just like that determined, confident capableness that naturally comes with a second wind.So we did our research and learned the science. We commandeered our roommate's SodaStream. We relentlessly pursued a natural, effective, balanced energy solution that we could truly call the best. We found Seltz, and we knew we had to share it with the world.We believe that merely "running on caffeine" is a compromise we shouldn't have to make. Caffeine shouldn't have to come with a trade-off of sustained focus and consistency for jitters or sugar crashes. With Seltz, there is no "running on caffeine" - there's only "running on you," boosting your body and your mind together to reveal the natural high performance of you being at your very best.Our mission is to elevate you to your peak mental performance, without compromise. Our goal is to help you reach your mental and physical best. Every day.The Seltz Difference "Seltz is the ultimate update to the traditional "energy drink," providing an improved mental and physical performance with natural, guilt-free ingredients. Our unique energy blend, featuring a synergistic combination of caffeine and amino-acid derivatives, is tailored to simultaneously boost energy and mental focus - all while eliminating the unwanted side effects of caffeine. This results in a calm, focused, sustained increase in energy and attention that sets the stage for optimal mental performance.Our drinks are designed with an "essentials only" approach: every ingredient has a purpose, and every ingredient is its healthiest version. Our energy blend is supported by rigorous scientific research and decades of anecdotal evidence from the health and supplement community.Our flavors are crafted from all-natural ingredients to provide a sugar-free, preservative-free beverage with less than 5 calories. Our dedication to a healthier, natural alternative to a traditional energy drink results in a refreshing experience unique to the energy drink space: our seltzers feel good to drink, feel good to work, and feel absolutely guilt free."​Referral RewardsImportant: You must be logged into your Indiegogo account and use Indiegogo’s share tools for the analytics to track any referral contributions. Referred customers must buy $30 or more. Timeline Stretch Goals Shipping Shipping will be charged after the campaign ends. This allows us to offer you the cheapest option available due to Indiegogo taking a percentage of the total amount raised. By doing this both you and Seltz save money!Support

title: Waste to Taste: 21st century food
text: About us The founder of Ekofungi, Mrs. Ivanka Milenkovic is a biologist and a mycologist. At the beginning of her career she has learned that science translated into practice is purposeful, and practice supported by science is successful, she stands by the belief that nature is the most perfect laboratory and that production that follows nature can only provide progress. Therefore, Ekofungi is based on these principles. Guided exclusively by the biological properties of fungi, very soon Ekofungi became a place of ZERO waste applied principle, and later an example of a real circular economy. Our production model, based on the open source model, is distributed to hundreds of entrepreneurs, who build their successful small business around the world based on the Ekofungi model. Success story One of the most remarkable successful Ekofungi students is Miss Chido Govera and her foundation The Future of Hope which networks and provides dignity and food to thousands of women in Zimbabwe and across Africa. We remain in touch with our students and together we weave a network of more humane progress and so we are together in this campaign. Complete circular approach Completing our cycle of production, as a necessary link we have introduced our local farmers, producers of organic vegetables. They make the most out of our already used substrate after growing mushrooms. We repurchase their aromatic products according to fair trade principles. Thanks to that, we have created a product that saves time, provides an ideal lunch for anyone who is in a rush and wants to eat perfectly healthy. Our product brings back scents of rustic sorts of vegetables and nature, which we think is the most important. Our Premium Products How to use EF premium products Our problem We have wrapped our knowledge, experience, positive energy and love into our bags of vegetable and mushrooms mixtures. Our knowledge and experience are great, but the opportunities to reach the end customer are not. Since we are a small company it is challenging to find support from any investors. That is why we have decided to ask everyone who believes in true sustainability, not only declarative but applied and tangible, everyone who believes in the open source model, cooperation instead of competition and in everything that we are, to support us. In order for our products, that exude quality and have a story, to reach the market where they belong, a sum of seven thousand euros is required. To make sure that you can really experience the true quality of our product, with each payment you will receive a few bags to enjoy the scents of nature. Our promise With your support, we will have the ability to get to our consumers through world's largest shopping platforms. If our plan succeeds, and we manage to reach those goals, oyster mushrooms, produced by the Future of Hope foundation, will also find it's way to world's market, and will no longer be isolated.

title: Gourmet Coffee infused with wild Mushrooms
text: No jitters or hocus-pocus, just hours of crash-free focus. Discover Mushroom Cups!This project is 85% funded by the Fund for Innovation of Small Businesses. Help us get the last 15% and bring our NEW products to life.BENEFITSFIRST TASTE REACTIONS THE PROCESSImportant bioactive compounds are locked inside the mushroom cell walls (the walls are made of Chitin- one of the hardest natural materials on earth that cannot be digested). Consequently, grinding mushrooms in the powder wouldn't get the job done. In order to unlock all of their potency Chitin needs to be removed: OUR PRODUCTSFinest Gourmet Coffee infused with Wid and Organic mushrooms for less than 1$ per Cup!Finest, Peruvian, Organic, Gourmet Coffee - in ALL of our ProductsWild Mediterranean Chanterelles - in ALL of our products​Lions’ Mane mushroom contains two specific compounds hericerins and erinacines, which support Brain Function and are the only thing on the planet with a fascinating ability to regrow nerve cells. Infused with Chaga extract (known as the mushroom of immortality) this blend will be perfect for those looking for strong anti-inflammatory, anti-viral properties, and extra protection against aging. Cordyceps is a go-to mushroom for storming through an exhausting day. Widely accepted in professional athletes’ circles as a great natural remedy used to increase cellular bio-energy & improve oxygen uptake/aerobic capacity. This blend will come in handy for those who live and breathe the sport and active lifestyle. SMALL BUSINESS SUPORTING SMALL BUSINESSESWith your purchase, you are supporting more than 80 certified mushroom hunters, and their families,These kind, nature-loving people are using the blade cut methodology to sustainably harvest wild chanterelles and bringing them to your tables while preserving the forest eco-system. INGREDIENTSTASTING NOTESMUSHROOMSCOMPARISONHandmade Coffee CupsWHAT DO WE CARE ABOUT?According to National Geographic over the past 15 years, bee colonies have been disappearing in what is known as the "colony collapse disorder," and some regions have seen losses of up to 90%.Every few months we hear disastrous stories from the shocked beekeepers who wake up in the morning and find hundreds of dead bees in front of their hives. The reasons are highly infectious viruses transferred by varroa mites. The most dangerous and deadly one is the one causing the deformed wing - the deformed wing virus (DWV). This DWV removes bee's ability to fly, undermines their immune system, and halves their lifespan.Luckily a recent study showed that Amadou (Fomes) and Reishi (Ganoderma) extract fed to honey bees greatly reduces virus levels. These fungi extracts reduced DWV more than 800-fold in the first trial, showing a huge potential this medicine has. It is obvious - Bees need mushrooms too. So for the past 6 months, we have been making mushroom-infused syrup for bees in need. With this sirup, viruses brought by varroa mites will hopefully become just a small inconvenience for the empowered and happy bees. *Music from the video attributed to Artistic organization Kabinet, Roses1401, SONGSTICKS, eeszsa and theojt.

title: Piedra Cocinar Cooking Stone for Healthier Cooking
text: Long Story Short We wanted to make one of the oldest and healthiest cooking techniques - stone cooking - accessible to everyone. So, we created a stone pan with a little modern twist so it could be used anywhere and everywhere - from the heaters to straight on the dining table. Healthy cooking. Delicious food. Long lasting. Retains heat. Eco-friendly materials. Good presentation. Even better price. The Bigger Picture These days, in this fast-paced world, we are always in such a rush. Barely ever do we take the time to ourselves. From high-speed Internet, to fast food, to high-demand everything - we are always rushing through life when we really should be slowing down and enjoying it. So we, a group of food enthusiasts, teamed up with some of the best chefs in the world to create something that would help solve this problem of rushing. Something that would be your tool in healthy eating. Something that would allow you to use an ancient cooking method at home. Something that would bring the family together. Something that would impress your guests at your next backyard barbeque party. Something that would bring out your inner Betty Crocker even if you’re the worst chef in the world. And most importantly - something that would help you wind down and truly enjoy the food and company surrounding you. That something is Piedra Cocinar. A stone pan that takes us back to our roots and reminds us to slow down sometimes. Now, we know what you are thinking… What? Another cooking pan? Don’t we have enough of those on the market? Well, this one is different. Isn’t that what they all say, though? But seriously. This pan takes us way back to our roots. 2000 years back. And reminds us to wind down, take our time, and enjoy the moment. Inspired by Mediterranean cooking and the Mediterranean lifestyle, we believe that every person should take the time to de-stress, slow down, and truly enjoy a home-cooked meal. Whether that would be every day or just once a week - Piedra Cocinar invites you to do that by helping you cook something truly special and keeping it warm for a long time. Why Piedra Cocinar? The Healthiest Way To Cook It is well known that the Mediterranean diet is perhaps one of the healthiest diets in the world. From fighting inflammation, to reducing the risk for heart attack, stroke & Alzheimer’s disease, to encouraging healthy weight loss, to improving skin health - eating like a Mediterranean has been associated with endless health benefits. Which is why we teamed up with the well-known chefs and Mediterranean food experts to bring the Piedra Cocinar project to life. Born in the small Spanish towns they continue their family cooking traditions that have been passed on generation to generation for hundreds of years. And their grandparents are living proof of the benefits of eating like a Mediterranean! Mediterranean chef Santiago - ‘’Yes, my grandma is over one hundred years old. She is still in good health and she is a very independent lady. And she still cooks daily. And what is most important - every time we sit around the table for a family dinner, she impresses us with something new. New aroma, new taste,’’ he smiles. ‘’Most people in our towns can expect to live longer, much longer than the World’s average’’. It’s Not Another Cast Iron Skillet or Non-Stick Pan Don’t get confused here. The Piedra Cocinar pan is not just another cast iron skillet or non-stick pan. It is something completely different. It’s the thing you knew in the back of your head that your kitchen was missing. And once you try it, you won’t know how you ever lived without it! Unlike most pans and baking dishes, Piedra Cocinar is created with gabbro diabase (black marble) rather than metal or glass. Due to the thermal mass of the rock and the material's property food is less likely to burn on it. Not to mention, for the first time in history, our Piedra Cocinar stone pans can be used anywhere and everywhere. It’s stone cooking taken to another level! The only exception - microwaves. But microwaves aren’t good for you anyway, so it’s a win-win. It Takes Us Back To Our Roots Even though we would love to take all the credit, we can’t. We didn’t invent stone cooking - our ancestors did. All we did was make it accessible to everyone by creating a stone pan that can be used in any modern kitchen. And, we don’t want to brag, but we think it’s pretty awesome and our ancestors would be proud. Created By Chefs That pretty much says it all. You know, if it was created by chefs - it has to be good. We are a team of Spanish and UK engineers, chefs, and food lovers. By combining all of our knowledge, we have designed a range of kitchenware so you could become a chef too - the Piedra Cocinar way. Even if you don’t know how to cook, our team of in-house chefs creates picture-perfect food recipes weekly for you to try at home. The Most Delicious Way To Cook We believe that the best things come from simplicity - fire, stone, and organic groceries. You’d be surprised what a delicious and healthy combination these three components make. Not to mention, you can cook absolutely anything on Piedra Cocinar kitchenware. Unlike with barbeque grills where your possibilities are limited, food does not dry out on our stone pans. They are specially created to lock in all the healthy juices within the foods. It Will Delight Your Guests Not only will your guests be impressed with how good of a chef you are (wink, wink), but they will also be impressed by the presentation as well. Serve the food straight from a large “share la plancha” or separate “a piedra para cocinar” for each guest. It Helps You Slow Down And Enjoy The Moment Since the stone stays warm for a while, the food will also stay hot and moist. So you can wind down, take your time, and enjoy your meal like a true Mediterranean. No rush! No Artificial Coatings It’s a well-known fact that overheated or scratched non-stick pans coated by PFOA or PFTE are toxic. In fact, birds die if they inhale PFTE. Humans can survive these intoxications, but the question is - do we want to? Just because we can survive doesn’t mean it’s not harmful. Just think about it - why buy expensive, organic groceries and toss them on to Perfluorooctanoic/Teflon coated pans? It doesn’t make sense. We say no to artificial coatings and want to inspire you to do so too. The Piedra Cocinar kitchenware is eco-friendly, 100% recyclable, and artificial coating-free. Handmade Made from gabbro diabase stone, hardwood handles, and lots of love, the Piedra Cocinar kitchenware is completely handmade in the UK. No slavery or kids labour involved in our production run. Just lots of passion and love for high-quality kitchenware, and a lifetime guarantee! Expect these pans to be extremely long-lasting, as they are loaded with naturally-formed layers of metamorphic stone - which is composed of silt ore, shale, and volcanic ash compressed over millions of years. Not to mention, the hardwood handles are boiled in natural oils to give longevity, strength and to revive natural beauty. The result - a beautiful, eco-friendly, one-of-a-kind stone pan. Please note this product is made from natural stone and wood, therefore you will find color and pattern variations in the stone and the wood due to the way the product is made. No two items are identical. Each and every item is unique. We like to believe that local is the new luxury nowadays. Products developed in Third-world countries can be found everywhere and are often bad quality, while handmade items are rarer and made with love. Honestly Priced We believe that a healthy lifestyle should be accessible to everyone. Which is why our kitchenware is honestly priced. No gimmicks. No BS. Just a truly great cooking experience. In fact, believe it or not, our one-of-a-kind products handmade with love are cheaper than the ones made in developing countries. Pretty crazy, huh? We think so too. Why We Need Your Help We need your help to buy more productive machinery in order to achieve even better quality products in larger quantities. This machinery, which would help us cut and assemble the Piedra Cocinar cooking stones, would allow us to reduce the prices and make our products even more affordable for everyone. Because when we say we believe everyone should be able to enjoy healthy meals on a daily basis - we mean it! Make every meal a celebration for your friends and family with Piedra Cocinar! Our Team Risks and challenges We have spent days and late evenings perfecting the design and usability, but as usual the most significant risk, as always, is timing. Sometimes things may go wrong that can’t plan for, but we are ready to face even unplanned challenges and ensure everything within our control and within promised timescale. To minimize the possibility of manufacturing setbacks and to ensure the quality meets our highest standards, we will continue to assemble Piedra Cocinar cooking stone in the UK.

title: Tap some Strange. Brewery and Taproom Buildout.
text: Strange History Strange Brew Home-Brew is New England's Largest Retail Home-Brew Store We have been supplying quality equipment and ingredients to Brewers for 21+ years. We are in the process of constructing Strange Brewery to provide our award winning Strange Brews to everyone. As we approach the finish line we need your help completing the Taproom so we have a great space to serve these brews. Join our Mug Club or Growler club for exclusive access to some of our Strangest Brews. Goals and Rewards We are finalizing the design for the tasting room now. Your support will enable us to provide a unique brewery experience. Our current space has already been converted from the Lazer Zone entertainment complex into a massive home-brewing supply shop. We have been redesigning the home-brew shop to make room for the Brewery and Tasting Room. We need to raise $15K to finish the Taproom and Beer Garden build-out. These funds will go towards: New Bar Seating (for drinkers, and tables for BYO Food) Fence upgrade for the outdoor beer garden Sound System for your entertainment Proper Glassware Dishwasher New Lighting (for that strange, yet comfortable ambiance) Stretch Goals: (Upgrades if we exceed our $15K raise) Complete the Buildout for existing 7 BBL Brewhouse upgrade Portable stage for entertainment in the lounge area Pinball machines and video games for the "Strange Room" Seating in the lounge area Upgrade seating in the brewery viewing area Barrel Program: to create some even stranger brews REWARDS: Mug Club, Growler Club, Brew your own Strange Brew, and more. Check it out! Let's get Strange Strange Brewery is under construction, and beer production has begun. Strange Brewery Taproom Opens 8/10/2018! We are currently brewing pilot batches on a 3 Barrel system. Sampling and refining is underway. We can't wait to share a brew with you! Taproom Summer Hours: Friday and Saturday 12-9pm Risks & Challenges We have our permits, we have our brewhouse, and Strange Brew is on the way. "Alright, alright, alright" Strange Brewery and Taproom will open, even if we don't meet our funding goals. But it will be a whole lot cooler if we do. Do you like drinking beer while standing around in a boring room, or chain link fenced in parking lot? No Problem. We got that! Want proper glassware, comfortable seating and a comfortable lounge and taproom? That's where you can help out! We have our permits. This was not easy. We spent the past 2+ years dealing with permitting, zoning and building issues. We worked with the town of Marlborough to change the zoning and requirements for operating a brewery in Marlborough. We have our brewhouse. Actually we have 2 brewhouses! We will be starting on a 3 Barrel System while we finish the build-out for the larger (and vastly more expensive) 7 Barrel System. If we exceed our taproom goals, additional funds wil go towards getting the larger system online sooner. We have the beer! We have spent 21+ years developing our brews and our brand. Thanks to all of our current and former customers who have helped bring us to where we are now. We have done many Strange Brews over the years, including recent collaborations with local favorite Jack's Abby with their Strange Brew, Sucker Punch, and Hoponius Black. We have an incredible group of friends in the local brewing community and look forward to many planned collaborations with our fellow craft brewers. (Supporters will be the first to know about these unique brews) We need your help. And we appreciate your past (and future) support! Other Ways You Can Help Short on Cash? (So are we!) No worries. You can still help! Please share our campaign with your friends. (Facebook, Twitter, Indiegogo share tools, etc.) Have skills? Volunteers are welcome! Taste testers needed! Seriously, we have some test batches and value your opinion. Look for Strange Brew at a Brewfest near you. Attend a Brewclub meeting and provide us feedback on our pilot batches. Email us your ideas for a Strange Brew! See you soon. Cheers! Thank you, Brian Powers and the Strange Brew Crew In the Press: http://www.milforddailynews.com/news/20180607/s...

title: The Sawbriar Brewery Taproom
text: Who and What is Sawbriar Brewery? Hi folks, my name is John Paul, and with my awesome wife, Jessica, we are opening the first Louisiana state-licensed microbrewery in the heart of Cajun Country. We need your help by backing this project to make it a success. This is our 2nd attempt at our crowdfund (this time on Indiegogo), with a lower goal, shorter timeline, and better rewards so those that supported us before get the chance to see this happen! Sawbriar Brewery will be a friendly neighborhood microbrewery and taproom in downtown Lafayette, Louisiana, where we responsibly brew better beer from unique ingredients while celebrating local art and music. Why Sawbriar? The name “Sawbriar” reflects our Louisiana roots. The sawbriar is a native plant common around the swampy woods of South Louisiana. They are deeply rooted in the Louisiana soil, tough and stubborn - kind of like us. Despite the thorny exterior, the sawbriar plants are a vital part of their ecosystem, providing food to the native wildlife and, historically, used to soothe the ailments of the local peoples. Like the sawbriar, we want our brewery to be a vital part of the community (and beer has been known to cure what ALES you!) Our mission is to brew better beer for a better world. We make great beer while focusing on using responsible techniques and local ingredients. With your help, our taproom will be your place away from home and work where you can interact with neighbors, make memories, live life, and have fun. Sawbriar Beer What kind of beer do we make? We make better beer because you deserve better.​ The advantages of having a taproom where everything made is small batch and nothing distributed are flexibility, spontaneity and craft. We make a large variety of lagers, ales, stouts, porters, and sours. Some are classically inspired and others way out in left hop field. All of our beer uses the freshest local ingredients we can find. There will also be a constant rotation of seasonal surprises. (What can we say, we like to experiment!) Some of the many brews you might encounter on our taps include: Love Bug Lager: 5.4% ABV, 29 IBU, 2.4 SRM · Perfect summer time brew for the hot and humid days of South Louisiana. Cold, clear and crisp, this lager is influenced by the pre-prohibition recipes of Old West settlers. Great for cooling down after cleaning the bugs off the windshield. Cypress Stout: 6% ABV, 15 IBU, 50 SRM · A different take on Irish Extra Stout brewed with local coffee. Cypress stout pours thick and creamy but goes down smoothly with notes of dark chocolate, roasted coffee and oak. Perfect as desert at the end of a meal or a warmup on a cold day. Crawnado Amber Ale: 4.5% ABV, 22 IBU, 8 SRM · Easy drinking amber ale made with Louisiana wheat and sugarcane that makes the perfect all-occasion pint. Great with crawfish, crab boils and hurricane parties. Mad Monkey IPA: 10% ABV. 90 IBU, 9 SRM · A creation of momentary madness and an aggressive hop schedule, this IPA uses seven different hops from all over the world. It is an exploration of the dark and hazy, juicy and spice. Far from a bitter hop bomb, Mad Monkey is a balanced explosion of flavors and aromas that will drive the sense from the senses. Fightin'ville Brow Ale: 5.7% ABV, 43 IBU, 27 SRM · Slightly sweet, American take on English brown pub ale, made with English and specialty malts, and US hops. Great to quench the thirst with lunch or sipping with friends in the taproom after work. Named in remembrance of the neighborhood surrounding Sawbriar Brewery. The Plan Sawbriar Brewery will open in late 2018 - this video talks about our first campaign on Kickstarter which didn't make it, but the project is the same concpet. Before we get there, we need your help to finish some things, like the taproom: Next comes the equipment. We have planned for a 7-barrel, steam-fired brewhouse and plenty of fermenters and brite tanks to provide plenty of choices of the freshest beer. There is a stage dedicated to hosting local musicians, because we know you like to dance! With a local community partner we are fixing up a derelict warehouse that currently blights the otherwise awesome historic neighborhood of LaPlace, also known as Fightin’ville. Still it seems like I forgot something else we needed… Milestones We've done a lot so far! Licensing and permitting is on schedule for opening in late 2018. Our starting recipes are fully developed, and even won a few awards! We have a lease for our building and construction has started. Some of our equipment is already here, and more is ready to ship. The final plans are complete, and we just need your backing to finish up. Right now, we estimate it will take over $200,000 to finish the work on the building. We are asking $10,000 of your support as seed money to get enough of the remaining work done to open. Cool Swag for Your Support We mentioned before that this is a relaunched effort on Indiegogo after our first one only made it halfway on Kickstarter. So we dropped our goal, made pledge levels more affordable, and added more stuff to each level! Need the softest beer shirt ever made (in Lafayette, no less)? Like seeing your name in awesome places? We have some awesome rewards to match every budget, because everyone deserves better beer! You Deserve Better We are asking for your help on Kickstarter because we know you deserve better. Without it, we would have to cut some corners, and that does not make for better beer. Our $10,000 project goal is much less than we have put in personally, and doesn’t cover all that’s left, but it does get the doors open. We've worked hard to get this far; we are 100% local and self-funded – no help from the big beer monopolies (ever) - just a happily married couple of beer nerds trying to live out our dreams. What makes us different? Nothing. We are probably just like you, working hard as we can every day to make things better where we can. Jessica and John are your average folks –two parents: a teacher and an Army vet. But Lafayette is the best city in the best state in the world. We just want to make better beer for you. Because you deserve better. Risks and Challenges With all great ventures there is risk. Here’s what could go wrong & what we can do about it. You may not like our beer. That’s OK! Like Louisiana weather, our beer is constantly changing. Unlike Louisiana weather, it will change. We use our taproom customer feedback to constantly improve our recipes. We could run out of money and be personally ruined. A harsh reality indeed, but with your help and our solid plan, we are sure to make it! The laws may change and prohibition return. We certainly see crazy things in politics lately, but regular voting will keep this from happening. That's also why Sawbriar Brewery is a member of the Louisiana Craft Brewers Guild. Our schedule may slip. Late 2018 is an estimate subject to final approvals, contractor performance, and a little luck. Brewer John happens to also be an accomplished project manager, so we are pretty good at adjusting to changes and meeting the goal. Meteors, evil robots, alien takeovers and zombies. Acts of God are unavoidable, but I guarantee we are praying daily for a favorable outcome. We wouldn’t mind you sending a few prayers our way too. And a map to your bunker. (We promise our beer won’t make you a zombie.) Other Ways You Can Help Share the Beer Love! Please tell everyone you can about our brewery and campaign. Indiegogo makes it easy; just use the sharing tools to share us on social media. Thanks!

title: Help the Tipsy Bean open in Erie!
text: Short Summary Hi, I'm Gisele, I've been an entrepreneur owning and operating local businesses to serve my home town of Erie, PA since 1999. I'm excited to share with you my vision for unique, internationally inspired coffees and teas, as well as locally crafted liquor, wine and beer set in a cozy, casual, and entertaining space. Located in the historic Federal Hill district of downtown, I've chosen to make my roots here to be an integral part of the revitalization efforts of this eclectic neighborhood and to be a mainstay in the community as a gathering place for great commentary, discussion, poetry, art, and acoustic entertainment. With your help we can bring much needed diversification to Erie's social venue scene. A place where families feel welcome and friends can connect without compromising on either/or...you know: either find a sitter and get wine, or bring the kids and get coffee; either listen to music and can't talk to each other, or able to talk but not with music and beer. I believe we should be able to enjoy ANY beverage at ANYtime with ANYbody we want, while enjoying live, local talent. Help me make this dream a reality! What We Need & What You Get We need $10,000 to finish updating our historic space to house our progressive little cafe, which includes: electrical and plumbing work, fire safety and ADA modifications, furnace and A/C upgrades. Many local businesses are already coming to our aid, offering discounted services and cost saving resources to utilize our fund raising as effectively and extensively as possible! The perks I'm offering are as fun and unique as our cafe will be! I'm offering a variety of options that will appeal to everyone, regardless if you are passionate about coffee, tea, espresso, wine, beer, liquors, incredible pastries or merchandise. There is something for everybody to enjoy at the Tipsy Bean! I believe we will be overwhelmed by the support of our community, but if in the unlikely event that we do not reach our $$ goal you can be assured we will still open and have you enjoying those perks next month. We have our list of needs and necessities prioritized so that it allows for us to use the funds that do come to have us open in November and complete the updating work while in operation. The Impact Erie is in the process of recreating it's identity and making strides to be a start-up friendly, tech savvy, locally sourced and supported community making solutions for international challenges. These are exciting times for homesteaders and transplants alike, but to entice people to stay or relocate here to continue the progressiveness we need to become the city that is also known for it's great social environment, inclusivity, diversity and dedication to artistic expression. The Tipsy Bean is a major component, in a strategic location, that will help create this shift for our city's identity. I want to utilize my experience in leading cooperative efforts by being at the forefront of collaborating with other local cafe's (and other supporting industry businesses) to establish diverse social and experiential opportunities for residents. Risks & Challenges The past year has been riddled with challenges, most of which I have tried to overcome on my own. Issues with re-zoning and repurposing have caused the greatest strife, specifically having purchased equipment I'm unable to use, requiring purchase of more equipment, as well as the difficulty in satisfying modern fire, safety, and ADA regulations in a 125 yr old building which sent the blue prints back to the drawing board 3 times. I'm so close I can smell the coffee brewing! I just need a little help to cross the finish line! Other Ways You Can Help Maybe you know someone who can assist in sourcing an affordable HVAC replacement, or you have a great connection for signage and marketing materials??? I would love your assistance in any capacity even if you can't do a monetary one. You definitely know people who would benefit from, and thoroughly enjoy spending time at the Tipsy Bean, so please share my story and campaign with them! Email your contact lists, invite your social media connections, friends, family, neighbors, co-workers, random strangers and passer-byers!!! Use the easy share tools here or just copy and paste the link. However you can support is greatly appreciated! =)

title: The Iconic Skyroom at Lampson Field is Reopening!
text: Hi! We are the Zabel's - Jeremy and Nicole. We have been presented with the opportunity to reopen the Skyroom at Lampson Field! After decades of working in various aspects of the hospitality industry we are thrilled to bring our experience to the community we grew up in and love while honoring the memory of the greatest restauranteur we have ever know, our very own "Red Jet", Nancy Zabel. She gave us so many of the characteristics we now consider our greatest values : work ethic, commitment to our local community, and always, ALWAYS doing the right thing for our family, our business, our customers and our environment. We can't wait to open and operate RED’S @ the Skyroom, a full service, family run bar & grill at Lampson Field’s iconic Skyroom Restaurant. Jeremy Zabel is a prominent local chef with a diverse culinary background. He began his career as a dishwasher at the age of 14 at his family’s restaurant and by the time he was 18 he had made his way to lead cook. Jeremy worked as head chef for 5 years at Park Place where his passion for sourcing local ingredients began. He was offered the Executive Chef position at the Saw Shop in Kelseyville in 2006. After a 10-year tenure with the Saw Shop, Jeremy made the move to Napa and worked as the Executive Chef at Hog Island Oyster Company. Partner and wife, Nicole Zabel has 19 years of experience in the hospitality industry. Her experience includes serving in full-service restaurants, diners, and cafes in both Northern and Southern California, event planning and execution, and managing full-service hotels including the Andaz in Napa and Hyatt House in Emeryville. Nicole and Jeremy have a long history of working closely together at several local full-service restaurants, You know us from the Saw Shop, Park Place, and The Yard. We love working together and can't wait to show you our passion at RED'S! We are creating a modern take on a nostalgic airport restaurant, featuring updated versions of classic comfort food while utilizing local, sustainable and seasonal ingredients. We will feature seasonal, local produce and proteins, responsibly sourced seafood local wines, craft beers and imaginative cocktails! We understand that not everyone can contribute financially however, we would appreciate you making some noise about our campaign and sharing our story! Thank you, Jer and Nicole

title: Tiered & Petite: A Dessert Boutique in DC
text: Who Are You Guys? We are so glad you asked! Tiered & Petite is the sweet marriage of soft, delicious "Tiered" cakes and scrumptious individual "Petite" desserts. To guild the lily, we make our own ice cream, white chocolate fondant, and handcraft exquisite petits fours. (#SoYummy)! We are: Minority Business Enterprise (MBE) certified Female-Owned and Operated A Licensed and Insured Limited Liability Corporation (LLC) MD & DC Food Handler's Licensed and Certified A Trusted Catering Vendor for PG Parks' Elegant Settings Venues Busy bees who buzz around the DC metro area delivering smiles for a living! Baseline: We are a bunch of cool creatives specializing in delivering smiles in the form of handmade, nostalgic, Southern styled confections - all freshly made from scratch! To see our latest creations and check out our client kudos, click here. Visit our website here! What's the Deal? Welp, this whole crowdfunding campaign got started when clients suggested we offer our yummy products on a daily basis in a permanent place (outside of our normal dessert catering for weddings, showers, and galas). We thought, hmmm … What an awesome idea! So, with the generous support from IndieGoGo, we will create an awesome, comfy space where the food is superb, the music is your jam, and everyone who pops in is having a good time. Here's What We Need We are soooo blessed and humbled by our fun-rocking, faithful and committed entourage of Washingtonians who continually support, encourage and love up on us. (#WeSoLuvd!). We have been working around the clock to get the ball rolling. At this point, we have 30 days to secure funding to lease this beautiful NE, DC location we're interested in. So, here's the thing: so far, we've raised most of what's needed for production and operations, BUT we need your help to raise enough to cover: The lease deposit The 1st year's permits and licenses Staffing Necessary equipment and supplies to begin creating yummy goodies Your gracious monetary (and/or physical) contribution will allow us to: Offer a safe environment for kids, grandparents, and you to chill, smile and eat (student & senior discount applicable!) Bake all-natural, high quality, unique baked goods, and savory delights Employ other talents seeking to enhance, hone and flourish their skills Donate our products to select annual charity events Offer complementary house-made doggie treats for your fuzzy baby Provide our very, very best to all loved ones who walk through our door!!! Here's What You Get Are you getting excited? Cuz it's time for the PERKulator! We have designed a beautiful array of perks exclusive to IndieGoGo for its contributors. *Be sure to click each perk (on the right) to view its description*. How ever much you choose to contribute will enable you to be part of our family! And just like family, we are committed to providing you: Honest to goodness homemade delish products like momma used to make Respectful, courteous and pleasant service with a great big smile Comfort in knowing each confection and savory items are lovingly made from scratch Unique, creative and outstanding products exclusive to our brand Other Ways You Can Help We are immensely grateful and appreciative of your support! Although monetary contributions will get us up and running, there are a few other ways to offer your support and still get behind our vision - for free! Here are a few options: Create a buzz. Spread the word on FB and IG to your dessert enthusiast buddies Donate your time for events. Volunteers are superheroes! Donate your skills for our events. Your pro bono superpower is much appreciated! (i.e., photography, radio air time, visual artist, painter, DJ's, etc.) Follow us. Keep up with our creations & kudos on our IG here. Visit our website here! Thank You So Kindly!We at Tiered & Petite sincerely and humbly thank you for your support, patronage, contribution, encouragement, and prayers. It's only because of you that we are able to move from our private Baltimore commercial kitchen to a local brick-and-mortar to offer our products on a daily basis.You are always welcome to contact us should you have any specific questions, concerns, comments or advice. Feel free to direct contact us here. Visit our website here!It is a true honor to work with you, for you and alongside you. See you soon at our opening!Cotton, Owner/Baker/Dishwasher/Hugger www.TieredandPetite.com | 240.467.3977

title: Misty Morning Bakery Expansion Kitchen
text: Misty Morning Bakery was born when our son told us that he was gluten intolerant and the gluten-free products on the market were about as tasty as the packaging. We knew very little about the gluten free market, so we began looking at what was available. He was right! Surely someone could do better! That someone is us. We started researching gluten free baking, the ingredients used, and what ingredients contained gluten and had to be strictly avoided. We baked a lot of bad bread at first but learned with each mistake. At a small business seminar, we met our first customer. That led to our first restaurant account and the rest is history. We started with a few baking pans and 4 hours a week at a commissary kitchen. As word of mouth spread, we started getting calls from other restaurants, coffee shops, and stores. Many business owners told us that after asking around to find who had the best gluten free products in Austin our name was consistently at the top of the list. We built our business little by little by selling some products and buying more equipment. That worked for several years. But now, as we approach 50 accounts, our product line has greatly expanded to include sweets and other delectable delights and we have reached the limit of what we can produce in our current kitchen. Fortunately, we have found a new kitchen where we will have twice the space and unlimited access. The problem is that this new kitchen does not come with the basic appliances we need. That’s where you come in. We need to buy a double convection oven, commercial refrigerator and freezer, stainless steel work tables, and shelving. With your help, we will be able to keep expanding our customer base and serve even more delicious products to the gluten free community and beyond. We have signed the lease and desperately need your help to have the necessary equipment in time to be ready for our giant leap into the future. So, tell your friends, family, co-workers about us and let’s make this happen! Every contribution at any level helps, and every contribution is greatly appreciated. We can’t thank you enough!

title: I AM WATER DROP
text: I AM WATER DROP™ “Water is my client” – Tanja Andrejasic Wechsler Dear Friends, Thank you for taking the time to read about I AM WATER DROP. Growing up in Slovenia, I was fortunate to spend much of my childhood by water streams observing water in its most pristine form as it originated from the ground of the forest. I saw that I was one with the rest of nature, that everything was interconnected, and that my humanity depended on staying connected to that primordial sacred place of life. Already as a child, I worried that we would run out of clean water. Later in life I realized how extensively ignorance and greed are damaging our environment and that healing the waters requires more than the few superficial efforts to repair the damages we created. A more permanent solution requires us to resolve the problem in our current thinking, which is that we see ourselves separated from the rest of nature. I became convinced that it was essential to bring sensitivity to and respect for water to the “public” to help heal our physical, spiritual, and emotional separation from the rest of nature and to point out the falsity of water privatization and abuse. As a philosopher and engineer, I decided to create a bottle with a strong social mission and to campaign for a more enlightened humanity by teaching about water and by offering an alternative to current water containers and the related marketing experience. I AM WATER DROP™ is a beautiful, natural water-drop shaped bottle created to inspire a more ecological humanity by promoting our relationship with the rest of nature and the delicacy of water that supports life. ____________________________________________________ I AM WATER DROP™: A LEAP FORWARD IN DESIGN I AM WATER DROP™ is an innovative concept and organic, nature-inspired design that offers a better alternative​ ​to​ other water containers in ​today's bottled water market. Through our design we aspire to: Honor Water With How We Serve It I AM WATER DROP™ is made out of durable glass and represents the profound beauty of the natural elements and energies in water. We based the shape on Viktor Schauberger’s theory of Sacred Living Geometry; that states the inherent movement, energy and life of water, like nature, is best supported, sustained and preserved in an egg-like shape. Create Beauty That Starts A Conversation We believe that water is beautiful and we wanted our bottle to live up to that beauty. The bottle’s asymmetrical shape emulates the natural form (a droplet) that water takes and is both true to water and beautiful to perceive. It’s our hope that this design catches consumers’ attention, and drives a bigger conversation around water. I AM WATER DROP™: AN HONEST APPROACH TO SERVING WATER No​ ​problem​ ​can​ ​be​ ​solved​ ​from​ ​the​ ​same​ ​level​ ​of​ ​consciousness​ ​that​ ​created​ ​it." ​​​–​ ​Albert​ ​Einstein We see an opportunity to seed I AM WATER DROP™ in high-end markets. By coupling the aesthetics of our bottle with the experience upscale hotels, resorts, spas, and restaurants aim to provide their customers, we hope to create momentum with key influencers, while giving these luxury companies an opportunity to demonstrate the commitment they’ve made to care for the environment. I AM WATER DROP™:A STEP TOWARD CONNECTION AND INTEGRAL THINKING "Understanding water is the fastest way to raise the consciousness of humanity and resolve our ecological problems." -- Tanja Andrejasic Wechsler I AM WATER DROP™ appeals to the large and growing population of people who are water-conscious and committed to purchasing products that contribute to the environment instead of degrading it. I AM WATER DROP™ is prompting a shift in thinking and behavior by uniquely promoting a greater understanding of water and our interconnectivity. The educational materials that accompany the bottle will build more conscious consumers and citizens of the world. Overall, the message in the bottle’s design conveys that the only viable, healthy solution is to sustain and respect nature’s equilibrium. Businesses and consumers using I AM WATER DROP™ are not just buying a water bottle but are building a community of people who are dedicated to social issues, justice, and water preservation. I AM WATER DROP™:A STEP TOWARD EDUCATION AND RESTORATION “Water is the source of life and its essential purpose is to continue creation." Centered around the vision of a sustainable environment, I AM WATER DROP™ seeks to change our habits and way of thinking through knowledge about water scarcity and quality. We have made a voluntary commitment as part of the 2017 UN Ocean Stewardship to preserving and cleaning our oceans. Plans to maintain our commitment include supporting Plastic Bank (plasticbank.org) by dedicating a percentage of the sales from each I AM WATER DROP™ bottle, which will translate into the recycling and processing of approximately 400 to 700 discarded plastic bottles for every bottle sold. In addition, sales of the bottle will be applied toward education about water and water rights as well as toward supporting water restoration projects such as removal of plastic from the ocean. Ready to Launch I AM WATER DROP was conceived years ago, but it took much effort to push through current limitations of mass producing glass in an organic art form, which was an important part of the mission. Over the course of this journey, I spent almost all of my personal funds, working with different designers and glass studios to achieve the design and finetune the engineering details. I have now pulled together an amazing team comprising one of the best glass blowers in the world, engineering designers, and a branding team. The bottle has now reached the ultimate integrity in design, materials and mission. We have patiently and lovingly nurtured I AM WATER DROP™ from the initial stage of conception to this current phase and we hope to launch in the next month and to invite investors. Expected costs for this essential pre-production stage, which includes a small run of 100 of the bottle, package and silicone design and sampling, are more than I am able to cover. We need $30,000 now in order to produce and show the first samples to investors and potential buyers. For our next phase we will need approximately $100,000 to cover the costs of the final tooling and silicone production; brand development, including the logo; final packaging design and creation; and marketing, including the sales team. I know that many of you care deeply about water issues and I would like to invite you to join the mission of I AM WATER DROP™ and help support us at this important stage so that we can present the bottle to investors and potential buyers. This campaign is also about uniting and offering like-minded individuals who share concern about the state of the world today--especially WATER, the source of life-- an opportunity to form a community that supports, financially and/or in spirit, the creation of a better world and a more enlightened and connected humanity. It is my hope that I AM WATER DROP™ is brought soon to today's bottled water market so that it can begin to inspire and serve to help change practices. I AM WATER DROP™ is water speaking to us -- reminding us of our lost connection and holding us accountable for our actions. To join us, please support I AM WATER DROP™ with a donation. We also welcome your help by asking you to share this campaign via your social media connections, networks, email and word of mouth, and by also encouraging your friends and colleagues to support us or spread the word. Press inquiries are also welcome. If you would like to be notified about the launch of the bottle or become a Friendraiser, please submit your email. I AM WATER DROP™:A TRIBUTE TO BEAUTY THAT SUPPORTS ECOLOGICAL EFFORTS “Beauty will save the world”― Fyodor Dostoyevsky Ultimately, I AM WATER DROP™, a beautiful nature-inspired bottle designed to inspire, educate and restore water, will help create a shift in the way we think about each other and water by bringing a real and honest approach and commitment to serving water. Thank you again for your interest in I AM WATER DROP™. We hope you will join us in bringing this inspirational and educational bottle to the world. Tanja Andrejasic Wechsler ______________________________________________________ About Designer: Tanja Andrejasic Wechsler, the founder of Our Humanity Matters, is dedicated to inspiring a more enlightened and sustainable humanity that understands all life is connected and interdependent. She is a systemic thinker whose efforts are creating a paradigm shift in public awareness of interconnectivity with one another and the rest of nature through the systems of communication and connectivity; mass media, products and water. She believes that media and messaging has become part of the nervous system of global society and must reflect our highest values and aspirations and further the connection to the rest of life, which humanity is an intricate part. Tanja was born in Slovenia where she completed Mechanical Engineering School and a rigid study in Philosophy with world-renowned philosophers with emphasis on psychoanalysis at the Slovenian Academy of Sciences and Arts. She received an MA in Media from the New School University in NYC were her mentor Paul Ryan deepened her understanding in Ecology and its relationship to mind and media.
